claims.text: Our sense of responsibility towards the industry is enormous. We understand the critical place we have, and if you are in a critical place, you need to be responsible for it.
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: IMD CEO Dialogue podcast discussing ASML's role in the semiconductor ecosystem and how the company approaches its market dominance
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames market leadership as moral stewardship rather than commercial advantage; positions ASML as custodian of industry advancement
claims.source: IMD CEO Dialogue - Europe's irreplaceable innovator
claims.notes: Strong higher-calling claim - explicitly invokes responsibility and moral obligation arising from critical position

claims.text: We discuss what will happen in 10 years, and then we work on what will happen in the next 10 years.
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: IMD CEO Dialogue podcast discussing how ASML's long-term customer relationships shape strategic planning for AI chip demand
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines organizational character as fundamentally long-term oriented; positions decade-scale thinking as identity marker
claims.source: IMD CEO Dialogue - Europe's irreplaceable innovator
claims.notes: Identity claim about organizational time horizon - justification terminates in 'who we are'

claims.text: We do things no one else knows how to do, but a lot of people do things that we have no idea how to do ourselves.
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: IMD CEO Dialogue podcast discussing ASML's ecosystem dependency on 5,000 suppliers, mostly European, for lithography breakthroughs
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines organizational identity through humility and ecosystem interdependence; reframes monopoly position as collaborative achievement
claims.source: IMD CEO Dialogue - Europe's irreplaceable innovator
claims.notes: Identity claim emphasizing collaborative character despite market dominance

claims.text: When you lead ASML, you realize very quickly that what you do has an impact on the world.
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: IMD CEO Dialogue podcast discussing leadership responsibilities amid geopolitical export controls and AI chip demand
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Elevates corporate leadership from commercial to consequential; invokes world-shaping responsibility as leadership reality
claims.source: IMD CEO Dialogue - Europe's irreplaceable innovator
claims.notes: Hybrid higher-calling/teleological - invokes world impact as unavoidable leadership reality

claims.text: ASML is a big company today, but it still feels like a family.
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: IMD CEO Dialogue podcast discussing organizational culture, accessibility, and minimal hierarchy as innovation enablers
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Preserves entrepreneurial identity despite scale; uses family metaphor to authorize continued cultural intimacy
claims.source: IMD CEO Dialogue - Europe's irreplaceable innovator

claims.text: Without ASML, the world's only producer of manufacturing equipment for cutting-edge semiconductors, the AI boom can't happen.
claims.speaker: Peter Wennink
claims.context: Bloomberg interview discussing ASML's irreplaceable role in enabling AI chip manufacturing
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Establishes ASML as necessary condition for AI transformation; positions company as civilizational enabler
claims.source: TIME 100 Most Influential People in AI 2024
claims.notes: Higher-calling claim from predecessor CEO - frames ASML as enabling condition for AI era

claims.text: Our engineers feel like pioneers and really have pride in shaping the future of new products coming into the market. This is how they get energized.
claims.speaker: Arnaud Hubaux
claims.context: Google Cloud case study discussing how ASML's engineering culture drives innovation in AI-enabled lithography systems
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines organizational identity through pioneer mindset and future-shaping pride; authorizes engineering autonomy through identity claim
claims.notes: Identity claim about engineering culture - from existing specimen

claims.text: The right question is what am I going to do tomorrow that really gets me excited, that really brings the best out of me?
claims.speaker: Christophe Fouquet
claims.context: Fortune interview discussing career philosophy and what drives meaningful work at ASML
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Redirects career ambition from position to purpose; models values-driven work identity for organization
claims.source: Fortune - ASML boss on career advice
claims.notes: Identity claim about work philosophy - models values-driven engagement
